statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Western Michigan 67, Eastern Michigan 64
article.story: KALAMAZOO, Mich. (AP) -- Brian Snider hit a 3-point basket with 2.7 seconds remaining and Western Michigan defeated Eastern Michigan 67-64 on Wednesday night. The win, Western's fifth straight at home, lifted the Broncos (11-13, 8-6 Mid-American Conference) into a first-place tie in the MAC West Division with Northern Illinois. Western sophomore center Joe Reitz scored a game-high 23 points, but Snider became the hero when he drilled two 3-pointers in the final 1 minute, 15 seconds. He finished with eight points and a team-high six assists. Carlos Medlock led Eastern (5-17, 2-12) with 20 points. John Bowler added 16 points -- his 15th consecutive game in double figures -- and had a game-high nine rebounds. Bowler was held to two points in the first half as he played only 10 minutes with three fouls. In the second half, he hit 6-of-8 shots and didn't commit a foul. Stane's Bufford added 13 points for Western. The Broncos forced 19 turnovers and scored 14 fast-break points to zero for the Eagles. The victory clinched the inaugural Michigan MAC Men's Basketball Championship for Western, which is 3-0 versus in-state MAC teams (Western, Eastern, Central Michigan). Western has won six straight against Eastern, dating back to 2003.
